unnormalised: Is buying a 2BHK in Mumbai a good investment in 2024?
normalised: Is buying a two B-H-K in Mumbai a good investment in two thousand and twenty four?

unnormalised: That's a complex question with no easy yes/no answer. Several factors come into play when evaluating real estate investments in Mumbai, especially for a 2BHK. Location is paramount. A 2BHK in Bandra will command a significantly higher price and rental yield than one in, say, Virar. Consider proximity to transportation hubs like the Mumbai local railway or the upcoming Navi Mumbai International Airport. Also, access to essential amenities like schools, hospitals (e.g., Lilavati or Nanavati), and shopping centers is critical. Look at areas like Andheri, where a decent 2BHK could cost anywhere from Rs. 1.8 Cr to Rs. 3 Cr, depending on the building's age and amenities.

unnormalised: Market trends also play a huge role. Interest rates on home loans from banks like HDFC and ICICI Bank are currently around 8.5%-9%, which affects affordability. Real estate prices in Mumbai have been steadily increasing, particularly in areas with new infrastructure projects. Check the Maharashtra Real Estate Regulatory Authority (MahaRERA) website for registered projects and builder reputations. Analysing property price appreciation over the last 5-10 yrs can provide valuable insight. A 2BHK bought for Rs. 80 lakhs in 2014 might be worth Rs. 1.6 Cr today, but past performance isn't a guarantee of future returns.

unnormalised: Rental income is another key factor. You can expect a rental yield of approximately 2-3% per annum on a 2BHK in Mumbai. This may seem low compared to other investment options, but property ownership comes with the potential for capital appreciation. If you're looking to rent out your 2BHK, consider targeting areas popular with young professionals, such as Powai or Chembur, where demand is high. Platforms like NoBroker and Magicbricks can provide data on prevailing rental rates. Expect to receive anywhere from Rs. 30,000 to Rs. 75,000 per month depending on the area and furnishing.
